subject: Sexual Health
title: Fertilization
description: A short lesson to help you apply Fertilization.

hook.text: Out of 200 million sperm, only one will penetrate the egg. It is nature's most competitive race.

buildup.text: Sperm swim through the cervix, into the uterus, and up the fallopian tubes to find the egg.

discovery.text: When a sperm penetrates the egg, their genetic material fuses into a single cell called a zygote.

twist.text: The egg actively selects sperm. Its surface chemistry helps determine which sperm can enter.

climax.text: In that instant of fusion, a unique new genome forms. Every trait of a future person is set.

punchline.text: One sperm, one egg, one brand-new genome.

quiz.question: What is the cell formed after fertilization called?
